passages.text: Our First Take: 2Q25 a best. Non- GAAP profits grew by \(78\%\) y/y in 2Q, 9ppt above our estimates. Key positives include: a sequential recovery in WMP transaction volume and revenues growth, strong momentum in the overseas business, and a recovery in domestic revenues growth. On a net basis, we believe 2Q data suggests Noah is on track to deliver business recovery in FY25. And we remain positive on Noah into 3Q, considering the recent improvement in domestic investment sentiment. Maintain OW rating.

Revenue growth sees sequential increase after two consecutive quarters of drop: Revenues grew by \(2\%\) q/q or \(2\%\) y/y in 2Q, 2ppt better than our expectation. This was supported by the stabilization in recurring income \((+3\%)\) q/q or \(+1\%\) y/y). We also note that revenues from the mainland business increased \(+7\%\) q/q in 2Q. We expect the momentum to continue in 3Q on back of the positive investment sentiment in China.

WMP transaction volume increased \(18\%\) y/y (or \(5\%\) q/q). The yoy decline was mainly due to mutual funds products distribution. See Table 2 for details. Looking ahead, we expect the momentum to continue in 3Q on back of the positive investment sentiment in China.

Overseas business momentum remained strong: Overseas clients grew \(4\%\) q/q to 19.0k, and overseas active clients grew \(8\%\) q/q to 3,650. Overseas business contributed \(\sim 47\%\) of revenues in 2Q25 (vs \(49\%\) in 1Q25 and \(44\%\) in 4Q24). Overseas relationship managers increased by \(16\%\) q/q to 152.
Rmb47mn income from equity in affiliates: This was likely driven by the mark- to- market investment gain for Noah's equity investment portfolio.
Rmb41mn losses due to provision for credit losses: This is higher than the Rmb3mn losses incurred in 1Q25. We're interested to find out more about the nature of the losses at the briefing call.
We expect mild upward revisions to earnings estimates.
NOAH, NOAH US Price: \(12.33 27\) Aug 2025 Price Target: \(14.50\) PT End Date: 31 Dec 2026
J.P. Morgan Securities (Asia Pacific) Limited/ J.P. Morgan Broking (Hong Kong) Limited

J.P. Morgan does and seeks to do business with companies covered in its research reports. As a result, investors should be aware that the firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision.
- We expect a positive share price reaction given the on-track business recovery in 2Q.

- Noah will hold a 2Q25 earnings conference call on Thursday, Aug 28, 2025 at 8:00 a.m., Hong Kong time. Dial-in from HK: 800 963 976; Dial-in from mainland China: 4001-206115; Dial in from United States: 1-412-317-6061. Password: 6509383.

Investment ThesisNoah is a leading and pioneering wealth management service provider. We like Noah's solid execution track record and the promising long- term growth prospects for its wealth business. Noah has a strong cash balance on its balance sheet, indicating potential upside for shareholder returns. The overseas revenue contribution has continued to rise as the company increases its overseas capacity. However, domestic revenues have been declining due to ongoing business transformation and weak new product sales, leading to weak revenue growth. We expect 2025 to be a year of recovery for Noah; maintain OW.

Our SOTP- based Dec- 26 PT of US\$14.50 is based on a cost of capital of \(16.5\%\) . We assume a long- term net profit contribution from the AM business of \(35\%\) . Our PT implies an overall P/E of 9.2x and P/B of 0.7x (FY26E).

For all Korea-based Research Analysts listed on the front cover, if applicable, they also certify, as per KOFIA requirements, that the Research Analyst's analysis was made in good faith and that the views reflect the Research Analyst's own opinion, without undue influence or intervention.

All authors named within this report are Research Analysts who produce independent research unless otherwise specified. In Europe, Sector Specialists (Sales and Trading) may be shown on this report as contacts but are not authors of the report or part of the Research Department.

J.P. Morgan uses the following rating system: Overweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will outperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); Neutral (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will perform in line with the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); and Underweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe. NR is Not Rated. In this case, J.P. Morgan has removed the rating and, if applicable, the price target, for this stock because of either a lack of a sufficient fundamental basis or for legal, regulatory or policy reasons. The previous rating and, if applicable, the price target, no longer should be relied upon. An NR designation is not a recommendation or a rating. In Americas equity research, some stocks under coverage have a rating but no price target; in these cases, we expect the stock will outperform/perform in line/underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe over the next six to 12 months. In our Asia (ex-Australia and ex-India) and U.K. small- and mid-cap Equity Research, each stock's expected total return is compared to the expected total return of a benchmark country market index, not to those Research Analysts' coverage universe. If it does not appear in the Important Disclosures section of this report, the certifying Research Analyst's coverage universe can be found on J.P. Morgan's Research website, https://www.jpmorganmarkets.com.
